comm_cricbuzz: 16.4    Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, SIX, another six. Length ball, around off and Anderson has swung it over deep square leg. It's that sort of a day. 18 sixes already

comm_cricinfo: drifts down leg for a wide
comm_cricbuzz: 16.5    Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, wide, shocker. Down leg. Would have been a good ball to a right hander

comm_cricinfo: short and wide, slapped down to long-off for a run
comm_cricbuzz: 16.5    Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, 1 run, looked slightly surprised by the short ball. Not quite the time to rock back and time the cut, so he's had to make do with a flat-batted smack to wide long-off

shortText: Basil Thampi to Iyer, SIX runs
comm_cricinfo: another six. Full and straight, looking for the stumps - lbw or bowled - but Iyer gets across and flicks the ball merrily over deep square leg for six
comm_cricbuzz: 16.6    Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, here's another. Shuffled across early, and was able to open up the long leg region. Picked the ball up and bottom-handed it over the ropes there. Just 4 needed

comm_cricinfo: full down leg, off the pad to square leg for a leg bye
comm_cricbuzz: 17.1    Faulkner to Corey Anderson, leg byes, 1 run, slow ball drifting in, deflected off the pads. An extra round the corner, and we are down to three runs

comm_cricinfo: full on the pads, off it to short fine leg for a single
comm_cricbuzz: 17.2    Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, leg byes, 1 run, another extra. This time the line's on leg-stump, the ball beats the whip and ricochets off the pad

comm_cricinfo: slow down leg, wide called
comm_cricbuzz: 17.3    Faulkner to Corey Anderson, wide, what an anticlimactic end this is turning out to be, geez. Now a ball down leg-side to Anderson

comm_cricinfo: and sealed with a six. A full delivery and straight, Anderson gets underneath that and sends it soaring over long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 17.3    Faulkner to Corey Anderson, SIX, Delhi have their highest ever run-chase. Anderson gets a full ball and pumps it over long-on to seal what was an easy win in the end
